intro: Lepisanthes bengalan, commonly known as the Bengal star orchid, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are elongated and革质, providing a waxy surface to retain moisture. The flowering period occurs during the warmer months, making it a visually appealing addition to botanical gardens and greenhouses.
